name: redict
description: Redict is a Redis-compatible data store implemented in Rust. It offers memory efficiency, performance, and persistence while maintaining Redis protocol compatibility.
features: Redis compatibility: Drop-in replacement for Redis with support for existing commands and protocols.
Memory efficiency: Optimized data structures reduce memory usage compared to traditional Redis.
Persistence options: Choose between RDB snapshots and AOF logs for data durability.
Replication support: Set up primary-replica configurations for high availability and read scaling.
Pub/sub messaging: Implement real-time messaging patterns with channel subscriptions.
Data structures: Work with strings, lists, sets, sorted sets, and hashes using familiar Redis commands.
Transactions: Execute multiple commands atomically using MULTI/EXEC blocks.
Lua scripting: Run server-side scripts for complex operations and atomic workflows.
Cluster mode: Scale horizontally across multiple nodes with automatic sharding.
TLS encryption: Secure client connections with SSL/TLS for data in transit.
Access control: Restrict commands and keys using ACL rules for multi-tenant environments.
Performance monitoring: Track command statistics and slow queries for optimization.
